item.title: V2 Network Protocol
item.description: Background Current State The Choria V1 protocol requires x509, there is no other option. Experience with mcollective showed that companies had little appetite to understand or use esoteric security protocols, even those based on sound industry standard cryptographic methods. Further most companies already had mature x509 infrastructure either standalone or part of systems like Puppet which made for an easy adoption path. Choria therefor is built on a protocol that requires x509 semantics and supports nothing else:
